name: Planbase
headline: Workforce management for modern healthcare
description: Planbase has everything health clinics need to manage their team in one place: capacity planning, employee scheduling, credentialing and payroll.

founders.name: Jack Light, Founder
founders.description: Currently building Planbase | Previously scaled AI forecasting and optimization algorithms with Elando to 100,000 hourly workers, PhD Economics @ UChicago, interested in all things labor economics and workforce

founders.name: Joe Shearman, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Planbase. Previously co-founder @ Elando.ai which automated scheduling and sales forecasting for over 1000 businesses including Domino's and Popeyes.

generated_description:
### Planbase: Transforming Workforce Management in Healthcare

Founded in 2023 and based in the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco, Planbase is taking a bold step into the landscape of healthcare by tackling the very real challenges of workforce management. Positioned in Y Combinator's Batch S24, this small but mighty team of two is led by a visionary group partner, Aaron Epstein.

Planbase's mission is straightforward: to streamline workforce management for modern healthcare. They provide an all-in-one solution that includes capacity planning, employee scheduling, credentialing, and payroll—all crucial tools that health clinics desperately need to operate efficiently. 

What sets Planbase apart? They leverage artificial intelligence to reduce labor costs, enhance patient care, and decrease administrative overhead. Their platform is designed to eliminate the headaches of disparate scheduling systems, which have long plagued healthcare providers. By reducing scheduling time by up to 70% and onboarding providers three times faster, Planbase is not just another software; it's a solution that acknowledges the complexity of healthcare staffing.

The plan is to equip clinics with tools that optimize scheduling workflows and harness predictive analytics to balance patient demand with staffing capacity. This means more informed decisions based on real-time insights, all aimed at enhancing patient experiences and reducing provider burnout.

For those interested in experiencing their innovative approach firsthand, Planbase offers demos through their website: [Join Planbase](https://www.joinplanbase.com/). In a world where healthcare efficiency is key, Planbase is poised to make a significant impact, proving that even a small team can revolutionize an industry. 

Whether you're a healthcare provider needing better scheduling solutions or a tech enthusiast curious about health-tech advancements, keep an eye on Planbase—they're just getting started.
